meanings.sent1: She inaugurated the game by explaining the rules to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The teacher inaugurated the science experiment by handing out materials to the students.
meanings.sent3: The cat inaugurated the new toy by immediately pouncing on it.
meanings.sent4: The sun inaugurated the day with its warm rays spreading across the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The chef inaugurated the cooking class with a delicious aroma filling the room.

meanings.definition: Officially open or start (an event or organization)
meanings.sent1: The mayor inaugurated the new library with a ribbon-cutting ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The president inaugurated the conference with a powerful speech.
meanings.sent3: The clown inaugurated the circus show by juggling pies instead of balls.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks display inaugurated the night sky with bursts of color.
meanings.sent5: The conductor inaugurated the concert with a grand symphony that filled the hall.
